thread.title: Storm Doris UPDATE: ANOTHER plane forced to abort landing in TERRIFYING video
thread.title_full: Storm Doris UPDATE: ANOTHER plane forced to abort landing in TERRIFYING video

title: Storm Doris UPDATE: ANOTHER plane forced to abort landing in TERRIFYING video
text:
1 of 17 Storm Doris will bring both snow and wind on Thursday 
Planes are currently being held in the skies at Manchester Airport , where the three aborted landings have been captured on video. 
Nine flights from Amsterdam scheduled to land at the airport earlier were cancelled. 
But according to Manchester staff, the airport remains fully open and planes are still landing. 
A Manchester Airport spokesperson told Express.co.uk they saw one land just before 1pm, but they couldn’t confirm which airline the plane was with. 
The spokesperson said: “It’s obviously windy so it’s completely up to the pilot on approach. 
“The runways are open and it completely depends on the winds at the time. 
“There have been three or four cancellations and there’s been a couple of diverts as well.” 
He said: “There will be planes in the hold and then they’ll come in to land.” Related articles
